text: Jong sun element(long , long ) i in Xrdi, j in krsi 1 sum element: 2 leaq — 0(,%rdi,8), %rdx Compute 8i 3 subq %rdi, %rdx Compute Ti 4 addq %rsi, %rdx Compute Ti + j 5 leaq — (krsi,Xrsi,4), krax Compute 5j 6 addq — %rax, %rdi Compute i + 5j 7 movq Q(,%rdi,8), %rax Retrieve Mxq + 8 5j + D] 8 addq P(,%rdx,8), %rax Add Mjx + 8 (Ti + ] 9 et We can see that the reference o matrix P is at byte offset 8 (7i + j), while the reference to matrix Q is at byte offset 8 - (5] + i). From this, we can determine that P has 7 columns, while Q has 5, giving M = 5 and N =7.
